Matthew has strenuously and consistently denied any involvement both before and during his original trial in 2011/2012 , at which he was unanimously acquitted by the jury, and his later ‘double jeopardy’ trial in January and Feb  2016.

https://matthewhamlenisinnocent.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Government to legislate and enforce a National Asbestos Register. To Save Lives!
attributes.background: Competent & insured surveyors will lodge asbestos reports & registers; they can then be downloaded to know the dangers instantly, thus allowing better planning, safer working & safety controls. 5000 people die in the UK of Asbestos related diseases each year. Twice as many than killed on our roads.
attributes.additional_details:
5000 people die each year from Asbestos related diseases - www.hse.gov.uk/statistics/overall/hssh1415.pdf

Any non-domestic building built before 2000 needs an Asbestos Register - it IS the LAW. Reg 4 of CAR 2012

Yet many reports 'go missing', are unavailable or do NOT exist. They should be lodged like EPC's. This would ensure safety at all levels of work; that asbestos found IS being managed by providing an easier, faster way of checking. Ensuring instant access to the most up to date report.

Michaela's Law
Make it law that all council run parks have CCTV in play areas

attributes.background: Access to broadband is now a key utility, & in business relied upon as much as water, light and heat. 95% of the UK is covered by some form of broadband connection is fine; denying the remaining 5% - businesses and consumers - (mainly rural areas) is a disgrace; & is creating a two speed country.

attributes.action: Fund adrenaline auto-injectors and training for life-threatening asthma attacks
attributes.background: Out of hospital asthma attacks kill 800 per year. News reports attest to the helplessness of parents and bystanders. At autopsy lungs are blocked with mucus plugs. Intramuscular adrenaline opens airways, reduces mucus, allows cough, and on arrival paramedics give it as part of severe asthma guidance
attributes.additional_details: President Obama's 2013 bill allowed adrenaline auto-injector use and training in schools for acute asthma and anaphylaxis with a Good Samaritan proviso. National Review of Asthma Deaths NRAD 2014 said "consider auto injectors if a patient had a previous life-threat attack or near fatal episode", which is no help in first time attacks. EpiPen, Jext, and Emerade needles pass through clothing injecting drug into thigh muscle; 2 or 3 injections may be needed. Ref. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207207

Before any new referendum Lower the voting age to 16
Allow expats out of the uk more than 15 years to have a vote
attributes.additional_details:
* The younger generation should be allowed to have a say on their own future. Not have it made for them by a much older generation.

* Expats like me, British passport , ex British army but lived in another member state, ( and have a business France for 16 years promoting and selling uk products ) were not allowed a say on such an important vote.

attributes.action: Create a cross Party committee to ensure a positive, inclusive exit from the EU
attributes.background: Many UK citizens fear that the EU exit will lead to a divided nation, governed by fear, hatred towards migrants, and a reduction in the investment in our public services. We need a moderate and progressive cross Party commitment to unity and hope. We want a urgent commitment to collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: With 48.1% of the UK population voting to remain in the EU this morning many of us have woken up to the shocking news that we are to leave the EU. We need to work together to ensure we build a positive outcome for everyone in the UK, and ensure that all Parties work collaboratively. The Government should urgently commit to a cross Party committee to oversee the implementation plan for the exit of the EU.

attributes.action: Make leaving an infant alone in a car unsupervised a criminal offence.
attributes.background: After seeing a 1 year old left alone in a warm car for at least half an hour while the parent went shopping around a retail park (with the child crying and setting off the car alarm) I was informed it isn't illegal to leave a child in the car. I beleive it should be  for the child's welfare.

attributes.action: Ban takeaways from using Non-Recyclable Polystyrene boxes & packaging for food.
attributes.background: In recent years there has been a concentrated focus on recycling. We are encouraged to recycle wherever possible, yet most takeaways/restaurants have shifted from using recyclable packaging (paper/card) to non recyclable polystyrene. Petition is to make them use recyclable packaging only.

attributes.action: Tax disc to start from date applied, not start of month
attributes.background:
Since 2014, vehicle excise duty has been solely electronic, with no requirement to show a tax disc in the windscreen of the vehicle.

Therefore with MOT and insurance being 12 months from start, there is no reason for tax not to be the same.
attributes.additional_details: People who buy a vehicle automatically have to renew the road tax on the vehicle. If somebody chooses to buy a car on (for example) the 15th of a month, they're losing two weeks worth of money for no reason, because the tax is back dated to the 1st of the month, when they didn't even own the vehicle. There is no longer a reason for this, given all details are electronic. It wouldn't even cost the treasury a penny as people still have to renew it annually.

attributes.action: Make sex work a protected characteristic under the Equality Act
attributes.background: The 2010 Equality Act does not include sex workers e.g. escorts, strippers, and porn actors, as a protected characteristic. Former sex workers can be discriminated against at work e.g. teachers may be fired if their past is exposed, despite it not impacting their ability to do their job.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of sex workers are also women, LGBT+ (particularly transgender), disabled or belong to an ethnic minority. While these characteristics are protected, the fact that a disproportionate amount of sex workers belong to vulnerable groups means that they are still indirectly disadvantaged in the workplace.

For more info on sex work in the UK: http://prostitutescollective.net/

The Equality Act and discrimination:
https://www.gov.uk/discrimination-your-rights/types-of-discrimination

attributes.action: We call for legislation to regulate the use of referendums by future governments
attributes.background:
We believe that the use of referendums should be avoided, as they undermine the process of representative government on which our parliamentary system depends.

We therefore call upon the Government to introduce to Parliament legislation to create a UK Referendums Act  to regulate their use.
attributes.additional_details:
The Act should include:
•	Criteria for the subjects of referendums – e.g., in questions of national sovereignty; also specific exclusions e.g., questions of conscience such as abortion and assisted suicide
•	Mandatory intervals between referendums on the same subject (e.g., 30 years)
•	A specified required level of support in the Commons for referendums (e.g.,  two-thirds of MPs)
•	A codified assumption that if a referendum fails, the status quo is endorsed 
•	Provisions to ensure that referendum outcomes are endorsed by a majority in the electorate (e.g., by “double majorities” or two-thirds support as for constitutional questions in the USA.)
•	A ban on simplistic questions which can be answered with Yes or No.

attributes.action: stop the sale of The Royal Citadel Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: The government is going ahead with the sale of The royal Citadel in the next 10 years. It has been the home for thousands of commandos, who look at it as the home and a place to remember the fall comrades. Once again we feel that we are being let down by our MPS WHO WILL NEVER UNDERSTAND LOYALTY.

attributes.action: Make Asthma Treatment FREE For Asthma Sufferers
attributes.background: I am a life long Asthma Sufferer. I was born with the conditions and throughout my life, I have always wondered why other conditions such as Diabetes and Epilepsy get free medication?
attributes.additional_details:
I am most worried about the 250,000 with severe (uncontrollable) asthma. It's thought they make up more than half of asthma deaths. Costs of their treatments can be considerable - they often need powerful steroid tablets and antibiotics.

Emergency hospital admissions for adults are estimated to cost the NHS £61 million a year and many relate to poor asthma control. 

Better access to medicines keeps people healthy, out of hospital and working. 

Those who manage the budget always look to save money, but charging asthma patients for prescriptions is a back-to-front and morally questionable way to do it.

attributes.action: Make the placing and/or using of all snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The frantic struggles of the trapped animal cause the snare wire to knot so that it tightens and the animal dies of strangulation. This barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too.
attributes.additional_details:
Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. A (legal) free-running snare is supposed to slacken when the animal stops struggling, however a rusted, kinked or knotted snare effectively becomes self-locking.

If any snares remain legal, then it is harder to enforce the law against illegal snares or against illegal use of legal snares.

attributes.action: Mandatory for every borough to provide a park for children with Special needs
attributes.background: Disabled children deserve to be treated equally in societie. It is taken for granted to go to a park as a child swing on a swing so why are children with additional needs not being provided with the basic childhood memories. We need every town to have a park for disabled children not isolate them.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this campaign for change equality for our children. Give Special needs children a childhood. A right to play!

attributes.action: Introduce a "Trading Standards" body for politicians
attributes.background: Politicians supporting the "Leave" and "Remain" EU campaigns are now backing down from their campaign claims and promises, with no punishment. A member of the public providing misleading sales information would be subjected to fines/imprisonment. We want politicians to be subject to the same rules.
attributes.additional_details: We want an independent body to hold politicians to account.  This body should have the power to impose personal sanctions for misleading statements. These sanctions should be unlimited fines and imprisonment as can currently be imposed by Trading Standards on members of the public.  The punishment should reflect the scale and impact of the misleading statement.

attributes.action: Ban gender-specific uniform policies

Nobody should be expected to dress a certain way purely because of the way they were born.

attributes.background: Government spend on brain tumour research represented just 0.52% of its total spend on cancer research.  This cancer is the biggest killer of the under 40 age group. More funding is needed to help research this most aggressive form of cancer that is killing so many people.

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy

attributes.action: Change the law to require all bus companies to offer free travel for children
attributes.background: In London 11 to 15 year olds currently get free travel. This should be available to all children nationally and the law should be changed to require bus companies to offer free travel to children nationally. This would reduce congestion & pollution as parents would encourage children to use buses.

attributes.action: Introduce a new written UK Constitution
attributes.background: In the wake of the UK's imminent exit from the EU, we need a written Constitution at this time of uncertainty to shape the relationship between the citizens and the state. We need a written Constitution that reflects the values of a modern society that is tolerant, pluralistic and multicultural.
attributes.additional_details: The immediate legal consequences of leaving the EU are far-reaching and uncertain for fundamental rights of UK citizens. We need a set of ground rules that we understand and which respect our fundamental rights and freedoms in matters of employment law, property, housing, healthcare, education, children and access to courts. The drafting of a new UK Constitution should not be delayed.

attributes.action: Spread awareness about Mental Health. It's a bigger killer than cancer.

attributes.background: We, the undersigned believe that The European Convention on Human Rights should be accepted as the minimum standard for Human Rights in the UK with the European Court of Human Rights as the final arbiter.
attributes.additional_details: If Human Rights are defined solely by the UK government then Human Rights can be removed from any group unpopular with that government at any time. The European Convention on Human Rights is designed to protect us from oppressive governments and its importance and necessity have not disappeared.

attributes.action: Merge mental health with medical. 1 secure ward in every hospital.
attributes.background: Why is there not 1 secured ward which can be used where staff are trained to deal with mental illnesses in a hospital? Why are M/H patients not treated with the same respect as those without? Do they not deserve the same respect and compassion as someone who has not got M/H issues?
attributes.additional_details: Nearly 3 months ago my sister started to develop a symptoms that needed checking she and her staff were told it would get better. She was finally admitted into hospital and needed urgent treatment to save her life. When we arrived I advised staff how quickly things could escalate. I had to ring her M/H team to tell the doctors how to sedate her. She was discharged after having a cardiac arrest the morning prior and we still don't know what happened. Many things went wrong prior to her stay and whilst in that shouldn't be happening. I can only see that the reason she was discharged was because the hospital could not mange her mental illness. One secured ward in a hospital with trained staff would change this and allow mental health patients to receive the medical treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Introduce stronger laws on anti-Islamism.
attributes.background: Muslims in Britain are facing increased hostility, prejudice and discrimination. Stop the negative portrayal of a whole religion and terming 'terrorism' with Islam in the media. Ordinary Muslims do not need to suffer for the actions of a minority.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of recent terrorist attacks; including the Paris and Orlando shootings, the whole religion of Islam has been constantly blamed in the media for the actions of criminals. There is nothing Islamic about committing any forms of abuses. Help stop bigotry in all the media and our institutions so that ordinary Muslims can live normal lives in Britain.

attributes.action: We the British public want our govt to offer the hand of friendship to Russia
attributes.background: With Donald J Trump as the new elect president of the United States of America and has recently offered the hand of friendship to Russia and Putin, we the British public do not see this as a threat and we want our government to offer the hand of friendship to Russia also.
attributes.additional_details:
In regards to the Independent newspaper publishing on 13/11/2016 Trump-Putin alliance sparks diplomatic crisis http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/trump-putin-alliance-sparks-diplomatic-crisis/ar-AAke2CD?ocid=spartanntp
We the British public want our government to offer a hand of friendship to Russia to work towards peace.
We the British public want our government to become allies with Russia.
We the British public do not want our government to plan on removing Assad from power in the east.

attributes.action: Leave the clocks on British Summer Time all year round.
attributes.background: Light evenings in the summer are widely enjoyed but it is a little depressing when the hours of daylight begin to shorten. Then there is the sudden jolt of even earlier darkness when the clocks go back one hour. Why not leave the clocks alone and allow gradual acceptance of the shorter days?
attributes.additional_details: It has been done before (1968 to 1971) and it has been debated many times. With the UK leaving the EU there will be no European requirement for a common summer time but, in effect, summer time would not be changed anyway. If businesses wish to keep in step with their international partners it should be easy enough for them to change their trading hours to suit; a side-effect of this could be to stagger business hours thus reducing rush-hour congestion and pollution. In areas such as northern Scotland where all-year BST would mean a mid-morning sunrise in the winter months surely it is not beyond the wit of men and women to adjust working hours as appropriate. Alternatively they could learn to live with it as do millions of people in other northern locations.

attributes.action: Abolish or reduce Vehicle Excise Duty (Road Tax) for Motorcycles
attributes.background: As most Motorcycles cover minimal annual mileage, have low emissions, help reduce congestion and do little damage to roads, it is unfair that owners have to pay between £17 and £82 tax per year whilst a significant number of cars pay none and many paying only £30 per year.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Use funding used for TV's in prison cells for TV's for the elderly in hospital
attributes.background: Many elderly people who have fallen or become unwell, have no relations, comfort or entertainment in hospital, yet prisons continue to have TVs for prisoners, who have other entertainment, and social lives, this funding should be prioritised to help older or vulnerable people, with nothing else.
attributes.additional_details: After having worked for many years in the health care sector, I have seen many vulnerable adults with no family network endure a time in hospital with no comforts, family or friends, for someone elderly or with dementia this can be unfamiliar and scary, due to funding, TVs cannot be provided for beds in many hospitals around the UK, yet many prison cells have TVs, on top of a social life, a small allowance and more. These TV's could be used to make the day brighter for those with nothing else.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties for bullying, harassment and hate crime in the workplace.
attributes.background:
All of the above costs the UK economy loss of monies. It adversely impacts on the victim's career, physical and mental health and personal life. 

As per NHS choices one of the causes of suicide is bullying.
attributes.additional_details: The victim's voice is often lost. There is a general disbelief and isolation when the victim raises concerns through in house grievance processes. It is " institutional failure " when the victim is treated with a lack of humanity and lack of dignity at work. Hence, the victim needs to be supported through the government, parliament and petition. It benefits the UK economy and the victim both.

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: UK Government to stop using the term 'Islamic State' & refer to them as 'Daesh'.
attributes.background: In the wake of many terrorist attacks around the world, the British Government must not associate the religious beliefs of 3 million UK Muslims with that of a terrorist organisation. Doing so aids hate crimes and the social campaigns of the terrorists. The name "Daesh" should be used in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: I am a Muslim living in the UK. When I hear the term "Islamic State", "ISIL" or "so-called Islamic State", I wonder why we are assisting the terrorists in their hate campaigns. I find it an insult to hear the term used, as would the 400,000 Muslims that served this land in World War 1 or currently serving in the army. These terrorists are referred to as "Daesh" in predominantly Muslim countries. The term "Islamic State" is a perversion of a religion, consisting of 23% of the global population.

attributes.action: Change National Planning Policy which permits inappropriate housing development
attributes.background: The current government planning policy means that if councils don't have a 5 year land supply for housing developers can cast aside planning policy and build on our beautiful countryside.  Local opinion and landscape designation are ignored resulting in development on greenfield sites.
attributes.additional_details: Across the country our neighbourhoods are under threat by developers who speculatively submit planning applications knowing that our councils don't have the finances or resources to challenge them.  There is clearly a need for more housing however a huge amount of brownfield available with planning permission which developers are land banking whilst they exploit the weakness in our planning policy that enables them to force through development on cheaper to develop greenfield sites.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for all branded takeaway coffee cups to be easily recycled.
attributes.background:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has alerted us all to the environmental damage that the humble coffee cup can cause. 
See his war on waste program: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07m8qwz
If legislation was introduced to force the large coffee chains to act then this problem would quickly disappear.

attributes.action: Make driving a Motorcycle with no protective clothing / leathers illegal.
attributes.background: My Dad was involved in a serious bike accident, which bought home to our family the seriousness and how dangerous it can really be. I am tired of seeing people riding motorcycles with just a helmet, I cannot watch another family go through what we have.
